title: Japan's Jamie Joseph promises South Africa a few surprises in World Cup quarter-final
text:
Japan head coach Jamie Joseph warned South Africa that they will not know what is coming in their World Cup quarter-final on Sunday.

Joseph makes just one change from the side that defeated Scotland 28-21 as Ryohei Yamanaka comes in at full-back to replace William Tupou, who is still undergoing return-to-play protocols following a concussion.

The Springboks meanwhile made their team announcement a day early, which included a 6-2 forwards split on the bench. “We will play towards our strengths, which is physical rugby, set-phases, mauling, scrums,” Rassie Erasmus, their head coach, said.
